We encourage you to be a part of the alternative financial system we are building. A system where each individual is empowered to create and manage their money without intermediaries and does not need permission to send or receive payments.

We believe that everyone deserves more flexibility and easier access to digital payments.

Together we are bringing People Powered Money to life!

frontmatter.actionTitle: Itâ€™s easy to start a Trustlines community!

node.html:
A Trustlines community can thrive with just a handful of people. Get started by simply creating trustlines with a couple of friends. If you want to expand your outreach, there are plenty of resources available.

You can utilize and co-create a Community Toolkit, take a leadership role and apply for a grant, or connect with others passionate about People Powered Money.

frontmatter.actionTitle: Build custom applications on the Trustlines Protocol

node.html: The open source Trustlines Protocol is composed of four main components - the Trustlines Blockchain, the relay servers, the smart contract system, and the client library. All components are easy to access on GitHub and developers are encouraged to build their own applications on top of the Protocol. Check out the developer portal and give it a try!

frontmatter.actionTitle: Secure the Trustlines Blockchain and Earn Rewards

node.html: Validators ensure the Trustlines Blockchain's security by validating transactions and adding blocks to the blockchain. They can earn Trustlines Network Coins as block rewards or from transaction fees. Become one of the validators by taking part in the auction!

frontmatter.actionTitle: Be a financial sponsor for your community

node.html:
The Trustlines Blockchain is designed to be available at an extremely low-cost. However, certain fees are required to keep the blockchain running.

Since blockchain fees are paid with a native cryptocurrency, and handling it is difficult for most users, delegates are needed to pay these fees on behalf of users. Delegates may offer this for free in support of their community, or can be reimbursed using Trustlines.
